name: messily
content:
messily adverb
(UNTIDILY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is untidy or produces dirt and untidiness: He wrote messily with a fountain pen. His flatmate eats messily and listens to loud music.
More examplesFewer examplesAlong the walls were shelves crammed messily with stethoscopes, hypodermics, speculums. He flicked his cigarette ash rather messily towards the waste bin, there being no ashtray.The stew sloshes messily into my bowl.

messily adverb
(SITUATION)
in a confused or awkward way: The series starts messily but gets better after a couple of episodes. The situation became messily complicated when he went back to his wife.
More examplesFewer examplesHis private life was deeply and messily unhappy.In an overheated market like that, no one should be surprised when it ends messily.
